text: Eleanor Sokoloff (n√©e Blum; June 16, 1914 - July 12, 2020) was an American pianist and piano teacher. She taught on the faculty of the Curtis Institute of Music from 1936 until her death. She taught many famous pianists such as Hugh Sung, Lambert Orkis, Susan Starr, Claire Huangci, Kit Armstrong, Craig Sheppard, Leon McCawley, Keith Jarrett and Sean Kennard. In 2001, in recognition of her tenure, Sokoloff received the Curtis Alumni Award. She turned 100 in June 2014. Sokoloff died on July 12, 2020 at a hospital in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania at the age of 106."Eleanor Sokoloff, 106, who taught at Curtis Institute for more than eight decades, dies" by Peter Dobrin, The Philadelphia Inquirer, July 12, 2020 ==References== ==Other websites== * Bio of Eleanor Sokoloff at The Curtis Institute of Music Category:1914 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American centenarians Category:American pianists Category:Educators from Philadelphia Category:Musicians from Philadelphia Category:Musicians from Cleveland Category:Educators from Cleveland
